oai_dc:dc.dc:title: To sing Christmas carols for Fannie Battle Day Home, circa 1940 December 11
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the boys' choir seen in concert attire, in preparation to sing carols on Christmas Eve 1940 for the benefit of the Fannie Battle Day Home. Beginning at the top of the stairs and reading from left to right, they are: Arthur Ingersoll, Jr., James McCaul, John Donnelly, Jr., Billy Parker, Larry Gates, Don Heckman, Donald and Douglas Witt, and Carl Gates. This photograph illustrated the front page feature article "Carols Will Fill the Air in Nashville on Christmas Eve," published in the 11 December 1940 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 13.5 x 9.25 in.
